intro: Nemophila pulchella, commonly known as the fairybells, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered blooms in early spring. Nemophila pulchella is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in well-drained soil.
